title: Create Feature Branch
description: Learn to create and switch to a new branch for feature development. Branches keep your work organized.

initialFiles.content:
# Challenge: Create Feature Branch

You're about to add a new feature. Create a branch for it!

## Objectives
1. Create a new branch called 'feature/add-login'
2. Switch to that branch
3. Make a small change and commit it

postSetup: cd ~/dojo-workspace/challenge-03-002 && git init && git add . && git commit -m 'Initial commit'

objectives.description: Made at least one commit on the branch

hints.text: Ask Claude Code to create a new branch and switch to it.
Try: 'Create a branch called feature/add-login and switch to it'
Ask: 'Create and checkout branch feature/add-login, then add a comment to app.js and commit it'

solution.approach: Use Claude Code to create a branch, make changes, and commit.
solution.example: Create branch feature/add-login, switch to it, add a login placeholder to app.js, and commit
alternativeApproaches: Start a new feature branch for login functionality
Branch off main for the add-login feature

learningPoints: Claude Code can create and switch branches
Feature branches typically follow naming conventions like feature/*
